revised_title: Artificial Formation of Diamond through Gaseous Solutions
tldr: The author investigates the solubility of solids in gases and discovers that certain substances, such as carbon, can be dissolved in water-gas at high pressure. By heating a gas containing carbon and hydrogen in the presence of certain metals and nitrogen compounds, the carbon can be deposited in the crystalline state as a clear, transparent diamond. The author also provides details on the specific gravity and composition of the synthesized diamond.
